creator: isaac@shabtay.com
text:
Got this:

ERROR  org.apache.fop.fo.PropertyList.convertAttributeToProperty(PropertyList
java Ignoring property: alignment-baseline="bottom" (null:1724:18: No conversion
defined bottom; property:'alignment-baseline')

Even though the Compliance page states that "alignment-baseline" is fully supported.

> Got this:
> 
> ERROR  org.apache.fop.fo.PropertyList.convertAttributeToProperty(PropertyList
> java Ignoring property: alignment-baseline="bottom" (null:1724:18: No conversion
> defined bottom; property:'alignment-baseline')
> 
> Even though the Compliance page states that "alignment-baseline" is fully supported.

What it says: "bottom" is simply not a defined value for this property.

see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xsl11/#alignment-baseline
creator: adelmelle@apache.org
isaac@shabtay.com
text:
I know what the message says. However, the link you sent is for XSL 1.1.

The Compliance page, however, states that FOP is aiming to be XSL 1.0
compatible. Also, all the links from the Compliance page to the XSL-FO
specification lead you to the XSL 1.0 spec, not 1.1.

Here's the link given in the "compliance" page for the "alignment-baseline"
attribute:

http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xsl-20011015/slice7.html#alignment-baseline

And according to what's written there (XSL 1.0 spec), "bottom" is a valid value
for alignment-baseline.

So it's either a bug in the Compliance page, or a FOP bug...

creator: manuel@apache.org
text:
This is an error in the spec. These values should have been deleted. See
http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/xsl-editors/2005OctDec/0006.html where the
editors acknowledge this.

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
